result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig J. ROSSANO was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection admitted by DA's office.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-01-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 06-11-15 at 3:00 p.m.    
Minutes.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery-dvo and resist officer-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-13-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety and have no abusive contact with Pamela Roissano and take all medications as prescribed.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
